rmi

Class RmiServer<TInterface extends java.rmi.Remote>

  • java.lang.Object
    • rmi.RmiController<TInterface>
      • rmi.RmiServer<TInterface>
  • Type Parameters:
    TInterface - the interface that the server will expose through rmi
    All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Closeable, java.lang.AutoCloseable

    public final class RmiServer<TInterface extends java.rmi.Remote>
extends RmiController<TInterface>
implements java.io.Closeable
    a server that utilizes java rmi
    Author:
    rverbist

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      RmiServer(TInterface concrete, java.lang.String host, int port, java.lang.String resource)
      creates a new server that exposes an interface of type at host:port/resource.

    • Constructor Detail

      • RmiServer

        public RmiServer(TInterface concrete,
         java.lang.String host,
         int port,
         java.lang.String resource)
          throws java.io.IOException,
                 java.rmi.AlreadyBoundException
        creates a new server that exposes an interface of type at host:port/resource.
        Parameters:
        concrete - the concrete implementation of the interface
        host - the host name of the server
        port - the port of the server
        resource - the java rmi resource name
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if the java rmi service could not be started
        java.rmi.AlreadyBoundException - if the java rmi service is already running

    • Method Detail

      • bind

        public void bind()
          throws java.io.IOException,
                 java.rmi.AlreadyBoundException
        starts the server
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - when the java rmi service could not be started
        java.rmi.AlreadyBoundException - when the java rmi is already running

      • rebind

        public void rebind()
            throws java.io.IOException
        starts the server, overriding any previous servers with the same name
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - when the java rmi service could not be started

      • unbind

        public void unbind()
            throws java.io.IOException,
                   java.rmi.NotBoundException
        stops the server
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - when the java rmi service could not be stopped
        java.rmi.NotBoundException - when the java rmi service is not running
